conclusion: Use Faraday's Law of Induction to relate EMF to magnetic flux change.
Initial angular velocity is ω₀ and voltmeter reads U₀ in magnetic field B₀.
EMF induced in rod M is given by 𝓔 = 1/2 B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω.
Initial EMF is U₀ = 1/2 B₀ ⋅ L² ⋅ ω₀.
New EMF requirement is mU₀ = 1/2 (nB₀) ⋅ L² ⋅ ω.
Substitute U₀ = 1/2 B₀ ⋅ L² ⋅ ω₀ into the equation.
Simplify to m ⋅ ω₀ = n ⋅ ω.
Solve for new angular velocity ω = (m/n) ⋅ ω₀.
